DataElement.preferredName: Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Cytogenetic Analysis Performed Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the results of the fluorescence in situ hybridization cytogenetic test.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Cytogenetic Analysis Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin (FISH) used for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities for the arrangement of chromosomes in the equatorial plane of the central spindle to form the monaster.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Cytogenetic Analysis
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION in which target sequences are stained with fluorescent dye so their location and size can be determined using fluorescence microscopy. This staining is sufficiently distinct that the hybridization signal can be seen both in metaphase spreads and in interphase nuclei.:Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.

Concepts.definition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.
Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities._The result of an action.

PermissibleValues.value: No abnormalities on any tests after diagnosis and before the preparative regimen

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Post Diagnosis Prior Preparative Regimen All Outcome No Abnormality
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.: Earlier in time or order.: The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to bone marrow transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur.: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.: Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.: The non-affirmative response to a question.: A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
Earlier in time or order.

The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.
To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.
The result of an action.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Knowledge on which to base belief.: Arrangement of chromosomes in the equatorial plane of the central spindle to form the monaster.  Chromosomes separate into exactly similar halves. (NCI)

Knowledge on which to base belief.
The second phase of mitosis, in which the chromosomes line up across the equatorial plane of the spindle prior to separation.
